page.title: 07PLAXTON'S WORKS, EASTFIELD
page.content: Plaxton's are a major employer in the Scarborough area. They have two large factory areas, the largest one being part of the Cayton Low Road industrial area, Eastfield. Plaxton's coach_ builders are the largest public service body builders in Britain. They build coaches, buses and special bodies for fire engines, etc. Plaxton's have been building coaches in Scarborough since the 1920's. Major expansion of the firm took place in the late 1950's and 1960's. A large part of the Eastfield factory was opened in 1961. Plaxton's record for sales was attained in 1979. In this year they built a total of 1350 coaches. In the period 1978 to 1980 Plaxton's supplied the bodywork on half the coaches placed in service in the United Kingdom.
